arrays: Focus on sliding window and two-pointer techniques.
stacks: Practice problems on balanced parentheses and stack reversal.
queues: Learn priority queues and deque operations for efficiency.
linked lists: Master reversing a linked list and detecting cycles.
trees: Work on binary search trees, traversals, and height-balancing.
graphs: Understand depth-first search (DFS), breadth-first search (BFS), and graph traversal techniques.
sorting algorithms: Practice quicksort, mergesort, and heapsort, focusing on time complexity analysis.
searching algorithms: Master binary search, both iterative and recursive approaches.
heaps: Understand heap operations and practice implementing heaps for priority queue problems.
binary search tree: Focus on BST insertion, deletion, balancing, and in-order traversal.
dynamic programming: Work on common DP problems like knapsack, longest common subsequence, and coin change.
recursion: Practice problems that require recursion to understand base cases and recursive calls.
hashing: Solve problems with hash maps and hash sets to optimize search and lookup times.
trie: Learn trie construction and applications in solving problems like word search and autocomplete.
segment tree: Practice range queries and updates using segment trees for efficient solutions.
bit manipulation: Work on problems that require bitwise operations, like finding single numbers or counting set bits.
